prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Base with Indented Side** The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular base with an indented side. This part serves as the base for the overall shape. **Step 1: Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0039, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw three faces with closed loops, as described below. **Face 1** Loop 1: 1. Draw an arc from point (0.0, 0.1887) to point (0.2278, 0.0488), with the midpoint at (0.4906, 0.0). This arc forms a curved portion of the base. 2. Draw a line from (0.4906, 0.0) to (0.4906, 0.1887) to connect the arc to the straight side. 3. Draw a line from (0.4906, 0.1887) to (0.0, 0.1887) to close the loop. **Face 2** Loop 1: 1. Draw a line from (0.0, 0.1887) to (0.4906, 0.1887) to continue the base. 2. Draw a line from (0.4906, 0.1887) to (0.4906, 0.3774) to create the indented side. 3. Draw a line from (0.4906, 0.3774) to (0.0, 0.3774) to create the top edge of the indented side. 4. Draw a line from (0.0, 0.3774) back to (0.0, 0.1887) to close the loop. **Face 3** Loop 1: 1. Draw a line from (0.6038, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0844) to form the side adjacent to the indented side. 2. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0844) to (0.75, 0.293) to form the top of the side. 3. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.293) to (0.6038, 0.3774) to create the edge that connects to the indented side. 4. Draw a line from (0.6038, 0.3774) to (0.6038, 0.0) to close the loop. **Step 3: Scale the Sketch** Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the entire 2D sketch. **Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch in the positive direction along the Z-axis by 0.4529 units to create the 3D part. Remember to perform a "NewBodyFeatureOperation". After completing these steps, you will have successfully created the first part of the CAD model, a rectangular base with an indented side. This part combines with subsequent parts to form the final stylized container. The length and width are both 0.75 units, and the height is 0.4529 units. You can now move on to creating the second part of the CAD model.</description>
